it.polimi.group03.engine

Class GameValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.group03.engine.GameValidator

  • public class GameValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists exclusively of validation methods that operate on a Game object.

    Each method is responsible for checking the compliance of a specific rule established for the game.

    The methods of this class all return a StatusMessage object that indicates the final result of the validation. The code s0x0 means there was no violation to none of the rules. Any other code indicates that at least one violation to the rules of the game was committed, the rCode returned specifies the exact violation.

    Since:
    11/11/2015.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    cecibloom, megireci, tatibloom
    See Also:
    Game, StatusMessage

    • Method Detail

      • validateBarPositionMove

        private StatusMessage validateBarPositionMove(Bar selectedBar,
                                    BarPosition targetPosition)
        This method checks the intended movement of the bar with respect of the final position. A bar cannot be slide directly from the inner to the outer position or vice versa. In order to check this rule, the method needs the information of the bar that the player is pretending to move, this way is possible recognize the bar in the game; is also necessary the target position to check whether the movement is permitted or not.
        Parameters:
        selectedBar - the bar the player wants to move
        targetPosition - the target position of the bar
        Returns:
        statusMessage indicating the result of the validation. This object contains a code which specifies the code of the error if any and a rCode with a brief description. The code is s0x0 if the bar is being moved correctly.

        And is e0x2 in any other case.
        See Also:
        Game, Player, StatusMessage

      • validateConsecutiveBarMove

        private StatusMessage validateConsecutiveBarMove(Bar selectedBar)
        This method checks the movement that a player tries to do when there are only two players left in the game, in order to do it validates the selected bar against the bars slid in the two previous turns of the player. In order to check this rule, the method needs the information of the bar that the player is pretending to move, this way is possible to recognize the bar in the game and determine whether the bar was moved.
        Parameters:
        selectedBar - the bar the player wants to move.
        Returns:
        statusMessage indicating the result of the validation. This object contains a code which specifies the code of the error if any and a rCode with a brief description.

        The code is s0x0 if the player is not moving the same bar he/she moved in the previous two turns.

        And is e0x4 in any other case.
        See Also:
        Game, Bar, StatusMessage

      • validateCurrentPlayerDifferentFromPreviousPlayer

        public StatusMessage validateCurrentPlayerDifferentFromPreviousPlayer(Player currentPlayer)
        This method checks that a player does not play two times in a row.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - player making the move
        Returns:
        statusMessage indicating the result of the validation. This object contains a code which specifies the code of the error if any and a rCode with a brief description.

        The code is s0x0 if the player is not making two consecutive moves.

        And is e0x5 in any other case.
        See Also:
        Game, Player, StatusMessage

      • validateMove

        public StatusMessage validateMove(Bar selectedBar,
                         BarPosition targetPosition,
                         Player currentPlayer)
        This method checks whether the movement a player is trying to do complies with the rules established for the game. Further information in the Reference section.

        Reference
        validateCurrentPlayerDifferentFromPreviousPlayer(Player)
        validateBarPositionMove(Bar, BarPosition)
        validateSelectedBarMove(Bar)
        validateConsecutiveBarMove(Bar)
        Parameters:
        selectedBar - the bar the player wants to move
        targetPosition - the target position of the bar
        currentPlayer - the player making the move
        Returns:
        statusMessage indicating the result of the validation. This object contains a code which specifies the code of the error if any and a rCode with a brief description.
        See Also:
        validateCurrentPlayerDifferentFromPreviousPlayer(Player), validateBarPositionMove(Bar, BarPosition), validateSelectedBarMove(Bar), validateConsecutiveBarMove(Bar), StatusMessage

      • validateNumberOfPlayers

        public StatusMessage validateNumberOfPlayers()
        This method checks if the number of player is valid i.e more than 1 and no more than 4.
        Returns:
        statusMessage indicating the result of the validation. This object contains a code which specifies the code of the error if any and a rCode with a brief description.

        The code is s0x0 if the number of players is allowed.

        And is e0x1 in any other case.
        See Also:
        Game, StatusMessage

      • validatePlacedBead

        public StatusMessage validatePlacedBead(Player currentPlayer,
                               Bead newBead)
        This method checks that a player places a bead in an allowable position; in order to do so first checks the number of beads the player has already placed, then checks if the position of the new bead is valid i.e if the new bead is not placed in a holed slot or if there is already a bead in the selected slot.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - player in turn trying to place a bead
        newBead - current bead
        Returns:
        statusMessage indicating the result of the validation. This object contains a code which specifies the code of the error if any and a rCode with a brief description.

        The code is s0x0 if the number of beads for the player is lower than 5 and if the position in which the bead was placed is BLUE or RED and if there isn't already a bead in the position selected.

        And is e0x6 in any other case.
        See Also:
        Game, Player, Bead, SlotInfo, StatusMessage

      • validateSelectedBarMove

        private StatusMessage validateSelectedBarMove(Bar selectedBar)
        This method checks that the bar selected by the player was not slid by any of his/her opponents in the previous turn. In order to check this rule, the method needs the information of the bar the player is pretending to move, this way is possible to recognize the bar in the game and determine whether the bar was moved in a previous turn of the current round.
        Parameters:
        selectedBar - the bar the player wants to move
        Returns:
        statusMessage indicating the result of the validation. This object contains a code which specifies the code of the error if any and a rCode with a brief description.

        The code is s0x0 if the player is not moving a bar that was moved in the round for one of his/her opponents.

        And is e0x3 in any other case.
        See Also:
        Game, StatusMessage
